hardwareAbstraction
Class ColorPoller

java.lang.Object
  hardwareAbstraction.ColorPoller

public class ColorPoller
extends java.lang.Object

This class is the hardware abstraction for the ColorSensor with additonal functionality built in. The colorPoller will never have values below 0 during normal operation. Therefore, negative numbers mean the colorPoller has not been setup.

Nested Class Summary
static class ColorPoller.ObjectDetected
          Enum of the two types of blocks.

private  ColorSensor cs
          The front colour sensor (on the claw)

          Default poleRate, set to 30ms

          Array of past readings

ColorPoller()

ColorPoller

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Starts polling the colour sensor

stop

public void stop()
Stops polling the colour sensor

timedOut

public void timedOut()
Polls the colour sensor using ColorSensor.getColor(), and adds the ratio of the red to blue value to the readings array

addReading

private void addReading(int shiftedProportion)
Adds a new reading to the readings array by shifting the older readings to a higher index and storing the new reading in the 0th index. The oldest reading is removed.

Parameters:
shiftedProportion - - new reading

resetCP

private void resetCP()
This method resets the color poller to a default value which is -1 everywhere. The colorPoller will never have values below 0 during normal operation. Therefore, negative numbers mean the colorPoller has not been setup.

isSetup

public boolean isSetup()
This method will identify whether the colorPoller has been setup or not.

Returns:
True if the colorPoller is setup, else false.

getObjectReading

public ColorPoller.ObjectDetected getObjectReading()
This method will average the past five readings. Then if the average is <= 0.9 it will return that an ObjectDetected.OBSTACLE was detected. Otherwise it will return with ObjectDetected.BLUE_BLOCK

Returns:
type of block detected
